backstory: Thomas has been driven - some say obsessed -
with figuring out the world since he was a young
child. Not in the way most people do, to gain power,
or wealth, or manipulate other people. Thomas
wants to know how everything works right down to
the level of fundamental particles (probably thaums,
but he isn't certain of that). He believes everything
is understandable, and ignorance is no shame, but
a sign to investigate more deeply.
As a result, he has little patience with people who
engage in what he calls 'woo-woo thinking'.
Warlocks and clerics, who gain power by sucking up
to higher beings, are, in his opinion, taking
unacceptable shortcuts which will come back to
haunt them. Perversely, he doesn't extend this
prejudice to people who don't practice magic at all -
not being interested is fine by him, he's only irritated
by people who do profess deeper knowledge, and
then start spouting inane homilies masquerading as
wisdom.
This prejudice colours his relationship with his great
aunt, Jenny Greentooth, who he loves, but regularly
refers to as a blissed-out hippie tree-hugger.
Thomas' secret desire is to know everything, and to
that end, the one place he most wants to visit is the
Library of All Knowledge. He has been a casual
follower of Deneir ever since learning of its
existence, and even changed his name to Thomas
Scrollseeker in honour of the Libraries caretaker,
treasure: Thomas Bookbinder. That was the last straw for his
family - who think he is still going through a teenage
rebellious phase - and they sent him off to assist his
Aunt Jenny, in the hope she could install good
Gnomish values in him.  It hasn't worked.
In his first real outing as an adventurer, Thomas
allowed his excitement to get the better of him and it
almost killed the entire party. He doesn't talk about it,
but he is APPALLED that he let his emotions master
his reason, and he is determined it will never happen
